title: Exploring Little* Language Models
text:
Welcome to my new blog!
In the spirit of literate programming, I’ll be posting about the process of running a fine-tuned LLM (large language model) entirely on my phone, and the things I learn along the way.
LLMs are notoriously resource-intensive. They’re usually trained and deployed on powerful hardware like GPUs, which are expensive and hard to come by. However, there are tools, techniques, and open-source models out there make it possible to run inference on the average personal device, like your phone!
I don’t have any prior experience in AI/ML. I’m taking a beginner-friendly class with Chris Kroenke as a part of Fractal University this fall. Let’s figure this out together!

*speaking relatively lol

title: core
Setting up the environment
text:
First, I cd-ed into lesson_0 in the Fractal_LLM_Course directory, and I followed these steps on the terminal to install mamba.

# check your mac's architecture
arch=$(uname) 
echo $arch

# download the appropriate installation script
curl -L -O "https://github.com/conda-forge/miniforge/releases/latest/download/Mambaforge-$(uname)-$(uname -m).sh"

# run the Mambaforge installer
bash Mambaforge-$(uname)-$(uname -m).sh
Then I created an environment called llm_base by following these steps.

# create the base environment
mamba env create -f environment.yml

# activate the environment
mamba activate llm_base

# install the python packages, after activating the env
python -m pip install -r requirements.txt  

# install the pytorch library
python -m pip install -r reqs_torch_cpu.txt
If I remember correctly, I think I ran into some trouble with the order of the last two lines. I might have tried to install what was in requirements.txt first, but then my terminal complained that torch was not found. So I did pip install torch first and then ran the two lines again.
